TF028194-DEET-LABOR MARKET CONSULTANCY
            (ALAN ABRAHART),TF028098-UK (ODA) CONSULTANT TRUST FUND,TF028065-CANADIAN CONSLT. COOP. PROGRAM,TF020290-IRISH CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND,TF020445-INDUSTRIAL SKILLS DEVELOPMENT,TF025208-PHRD-TRAINING POL. & INST. REFORM

abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the project is rated
            satisfactory, based on the successful, though belated,
            project implementation, and, accomplishment of the
            development objectives. The key lessons convey, that, after
            overcoming the administrative difficulties, the inclusion of
            the standard operating procedures, and, funding mechanisms,
            contributed to the management decentralization, and, the
            delivery of training at the provincial level. This was
            emphasized by the willingness of the private sector, even
            during recession, to take responsibility in the training of
            their employees, for, while some resistance from small firms
            exist towards the concept of cost sharing, most enterprises
            are willing to accept this model, and contribute to training
            costs. The experience gained by the Ministry of Manpower
            under the project was valuable, in that, the new policy
            initiative extends the use of variations of the cost sharing
            model to labor market programs, along with decentralized
            budgeting and provincial control. This decentralization,
            contributed to the smooth special fund mechanism operation,
            to be used widely in further projects. However, operating
            procedures should be developed, and tested, to allow further
            accountability in performance and the use of funds. Based on
            this experience, the time frame for these operations, is
            suggested to be six years, with the provision to include
            analytical methods for early corrective actions.
